definition: flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: The interviewer spends a lot of time answering your questions.
sentences.chinese: 面试官花大批时间答复你的问题。

sentences.english: I have a job interview in an hour and none of it is coming off.
sentences.chinese: 我一个小时以后要去面试，这些玩意怎么也洗不掉。

sentences.english: In most cases the interviewer will give you feedback on the test.
sentences.chinese: 在大多数情况下，该面试官会给你测试反馈信息。

sentences.english: Thank the interviewer for taking the time to speak with you.
sentences.chinese: 对面试官花时间表示感谢。

sentences.english: How to impress the interviewer within 10 seconds?
sentences.chinese: 如何在10秒钟内打动面试官？

sentences.english: Well, thats all for the interview.
A shake hands as you say good-bye and thank the interviewer for spending time with you.
sentences.chinese: 道别时要握手感谢雇主花时间面试你。

sentences.english: Each ace of kylin daredevil gathered in the interview venue.
sentences.chinese: 各家好手齐聚的麒麟艺高的面试会场。

sentences.english: Have you been interviewed for a post with Youchange Foundation?
sentences.chinese: 您以前是否面试过友成基金会的其他职位？

sentences.english: Employment interview is the process of transferring information between interviewers and interviewees.
sentences.chinese: 面试是面试官与应聘者进行面对面交流的过程。

sentences.english: Employment interview is the process of transferring information between interviewers and interviewees.
sentences.chinese: 面试是面试官与应聘者进行面对面交流的过程。

sentences.english: But an interview is not an interrogation; it's a conversation.
sentences.chinese: 但是面试并非是审问，而是一次交谈。

sentences.english: In what division is the position for which you are interviewing?
sentences.chinese: 你将参与面试的部门确切又是属于哪个部门的？

sentences.english: She wore her suit to the job interview.
sentences.chinese: 她穿上套裙去参加求职面试。

sentences.english: A: Hi, Mrs Smith, this is Yang Guang. You interviewed me a few days ago.
sentences.chinese: 你好，史密斯女士，我是杨光，几天前你面试过我。

sentences.english: The telephone interview and other interview formats are discussed in Chapter 4.
sentences.chinese: 电话面试和其他面试格式见第四章。

definition: to accept a job offer/to apply for an advertised position
to sit for the second round of a two-stage exam
an examiner/an official conducting an exam
to hire (an employee)/to accept (a manuscript) for publication
to invite applications for a job/to recruit
